instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: 820 3787 - Don't turn on - Green light
threads.message:
Hey guys,
this one came with no green light and with battery the machine turn one! Using my DC power suplply i noticed the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> a little hot. Replace the isl and green light appear!
Now i have 3.7V o PPBUS! Already replace 2 times the ISL for a new one! and i need to replace <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR>. 
i have 4.9ohm on <CAPACITOR>C7150</CAPACITOR> and 22.8ohm on <CAPACITOR>C7150</CAPACITOR>. 

I don't want to touch in other components without certainties! 

any advice are welcome! 

thanks

threads.title: 820 3787 - Don't turn on - Green light
threads.message:
Did you try SMC bypass?
Are you using original 85W charger for sure?
Post some voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; pins 1, 2, 3, 12, 13, 9, 15, 19, 20, 26, 27.

threads.title: 820 3787 - Don't turn on - Green light
threads.message:
Yes i'm using a original Charger 85W. And not start in SMC byass! 

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>:

pin1 - 0V
pin2 - 16.41V
pin3 - 3.89V
pin12 - 3.42V
pin13 - 3.39V
pin9 - 0.03V
pin15 - 0.054V
pin19 - 5.52V
pin20 - 5.53V
pin26 - 14.74V
pin27 - 20.14V

threads.title: 820 3787 - Don't turn on - Green light
threads.message:
On battery only, OSX recognizes battery percentage?

"pin26 - 14.74V"
Too low for 85W charger.
Be sure all <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>-22 are good.
If charger is really 85W, then change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: 820 3787 - Don't turn on - Green light
threads.message:
Ok it's Working!
This one ended my resistors 10ohm off my pile!
Needed to replace the resistors + <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> + Q780 at once!

Solved! Ty Mr.Vali one more time
